tit.cmt: 祇園東→Gion Higashi[”東”の意味を説明するため、英訳を付けました]

sen.j: 祇園東（ぎおんひがし）は京都市東山区四条通花見小路通上ル東側に位置する花街。
sen.e: Gion Higashi is a geisha square located on the east side of Hanamikoji-dori Agaru, Shijo-dori, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.
Gion Higashi is a hanamachi ('flower town,' or geisha district), located on the east side of Hanamikoji-dori Agaru, Shijo-dori, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.

Gion Higashi is a hanamachi ('flower town,' or geisha district), located on the east side of the north of the intersection of the Shijo-dori Street and the Hanami-koji Street, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: 住所（場所）はこのようにしました。。

sen.j: 江戸初期に八坂神社の門前で営業された水茶屋がこの花街の始まりである。
sen.e: This geisha square started from the establishment of Mizujaya (public teahouse) operated in front of Yasaka-jinja Shrine during the early Edo period.
This geisha square started from the establishment of Mizujaya (public teahouse) which operated in front of Yasaka-jinja Shrine during the early Edo period.
It started with the opening of a tea house in front of the gate of the Yasaka-jinja Shrine in the beginning of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 後に行政からも花街として公認されることになったが、この際に団子をモチーフにした紋章が作られた。
sen.e: Thereafter, it was also certified officially as geisha square by the administration, and at this time, an emblem in the motif of Dango (rice dumpling) was established.
Thereafter, it was also officially certified as a geisha square by the administration, and at this time, an emblem in the motif of Dango (rice dumpling) was established.
Subsequently, it received official approval for the hanamachi, and the emblem featuring a dumpling cake was created.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: この紋章は 現在も祇園甲部と祇園東の紋章として使われている。
sen.e: This emblem is used as an emblem of both Gion Ko-bu and Gion Higashi even now.
This emblem is used as an emblem for both Gion Ko-bu and Gion Higashi.
It is still used as an emblem for both Gion Kobu and Gion Higashi.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 江戸末期にはお茶屋が500軒、芸妓、舞妓、娼妓合わせて1000人以上いたといい、文人や政治家等に愛され大いに繁栄した。
sen.e: It is said that Gion Higashi had 500 Ochaya (teahouses), and at least 1,000 geisha girls, apprentice geisha and prostitutes in total, during the late Edo period, and was flourished greatly thanks to appreciation by literary persons, politicians, etc.

It is said that Gion Higashi had 500 Ochaya (teahouses), and at least 1,000 geisha girls, apprentice geisha and prostitutes during the late Edo period, and flourished thanks to appreciation by literary persons, politicians, etc.

At the end of the Edo period, it was said to have boasted five hundred tea houses and more than one thousand of geisha, apprentice geisha and shogi (prostitutes) in total, and flourished thanks to appreciation by many prominent figures such as literati and politicians.
sen.cmt: 他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 明治に入ると祇園甲部から分離独立した。
sen.e: In the Meiji period, Gion Higashi was separated from Gion Ko-bu, and became independent.
In the Meiji period, Gion Higashi was separated from Gion Ko-bu, and became independent.
In the Meiji period, Gion Higashi was separated from Gion Kobu, and became independent.

sen.j: 一時は『祇園乙部』と称されたが、戦後は名称を『祇園東』に改め現在に至る。
sen.e: Gion Higashi was temporarily named "Gion Otsu-bu," but the name was changed to "Gion Higashi" after the war, and this name is still used now.
Gion Higashi was temporarily named "Gion Otsu-bu," but the name was changed to "Gion Higashi" after the war, which is still used to this day.

Gion Higashi was temporarily named "Gion Otsubu" ('ko' and 'otsu' in Japanese are equivalent to a and b in English), but the name was changed to "Gion Higashi" after the war, which is still used to this day.
sen.cmt: otsubu としました。 甲と乙の説明を追加しました。

sen.j: 祇園東の一帯はかつて膳所藩屋敷が存在していたことから地元では『膳所裏』と呼ばれていた。
sen.e: The area around Gion Higashi used to be called "Zezeura (back of Zeze)" because residences of the Zeze clan existed.
The area around Gion Higashi used to be called "Zezeura (back of Zeze)" due to the Zeze clan which used to reside in the area.
The area around Gion Higashi used to be called " (back of Zeze) due to the Zeze clan which used to reside in the area.

sen.j: 近年の芸妓数減少で後継者難に極めている。
sen.e: It is quite difficult to find successors because the number of geisha girls decreases recently.
It is quite difficult to find successors due to the recent decrease in geisha girls.
It is quite difficult to find successors due to the recent decrease in geisha.

sen.j: 毎年、秋になると「祇園をどり」が開催される。
sen.e: In autumn, 'Gion Odori (Gion Dance)' is held every year.
The 'Gion Odori (Gion Dance)' is held every year in autumn.
The 'Gion Odori' (Gion Dance) is held every year in autumn.
